original: 2. TERM. Unless sooner terminated under the provisions hereof, this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and  continue for a period of one (1) year ( “Term”). provided however, that the Parties may extend the Term for an  additional year period by entering into an written addendum of the Agreement extending such term.
ollama_generated: 2. TERM. This Agreement shall remain in effect from the Effective Date, renewable annually unless either Party elects to terminate it under the stipulated conditions herein. However, should both Parties mutually agree in writing, they may choose to prolong this Agreement for an additional year or successive years beyond the initial one-year period.

original: a. In consideration for the rights granted hereunder and for the promotional appearances  provided herein, Bizzingo, subject to the other terms and conditions herein, agrees to pay to Theismann during the Term the royalty  recited in Schedule A (the “Royalty”).
ollama_generated: a. In exchange for the rights conferred herein and the promotional engagements specified within, Theismann, subject to the other provisions of this agreement, is entitled to receive from Bizzingo, during the Term, the royalty amount as outlined in Schedule A (the "Royalty"). This payment obligation is contingent upon Bizzingo's compliance with all terms and conditions set forth herein. (Note: The original clause required Bizzingo to pay royalties, while this revised version positions Theismann to receive royalties, shifting the responsibility from Bizzingo to Theismann.)

original: d. Bizzingo agrees to defend, indemnify, and hold Theismann harmless against all costs,  expenses, and losses (including reasonable attorney fees and costs) incurred through claims of third parties against Theismann  based on the manufacture or sale of the Network including, but not limited to, actions founded on network liability. In this regarding,  within thirty (30) days from the execution of this Agreement, Bizzingo will secure an insurance policy with limits of $5,000,000  per event and $ 5,000,000 umbrella, naming Theismann as an additional insured, covering the losses and claims stated in this sub -paragraph  d.
ollama_generated: d. Bizzingo shall assume liability, compensate, and safeguard Theismann from all expenses, damages, and losses (including reasonable attorney fees) that arise due to third-party claims against Theismann, primarily associated with the manufacture or distribution of the Network. These claims may stem from actions related to network responsibility. In this context, Bizzingo is obliged to obtain an insurance policy within thirty (30) days of this Agreement's signing, with a coverage of $5,000,000 per incident and $5,000,000 in aggregate, Theismann being included as an additional insured. This policy shall cover the losses and claims mentioned in this sub-paragraph d.

original: a. Theismann shall have the right  to terminate this Agreement upon thirty (30) days prior written notice to Bizzingo upon the occurrence of any of the following:
modified:
b. Bizzingo shall retain the prerogative to discontinue this Agreement following a written notification, served on Theismann, of thirty (30) days' duration, under any of the subsequent circumstances:

In this revised version, the original clause grants Theismann the right to terminate the agreement at will with prior notice. In the rewritten version, I have flipped the situation so that Bizzingo now retains the prerogative (right) to discontinue the agreement, given them the initiative to terminate. This subtle change shifts the responsibility and power dynamics slightly from Theismann to Bizzingo.

original: 13. JURISDICTION/DISPUTES. The Parties hereby agree that all disputes related to this Agreement shall be settled by arbitration  pursuant to the rules and regulations of the American Arbitration Association. Parties all consent to the jurisdiction of such  courts, agree to accept service of process by mail, and hereby waive any jurisdictional or venue defenses otherwise available to  it 14. AGREEMENT BINDING ON SUCCESSORS. The provisions of the Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit  of the Parties hereto, their heirs, administrators, successors and assigns.
modified:
13. JURISDICTION/DISPUTES RESOLUTION. In the event of any disputes arising from this Agreement, the Parties agree to engage in good faith negotiations with the aim of resolving the dispute amicably. If such efforts fail, then arbitration shall be sought in accordance with the rules and regulations of the American Arbitration Association. The Parties acknowledge and consent to the jurisdiction of such courts, and accept service of process by mail. However, parties reserve the right to challenge any jurisdictional or venue issues that may arise.

14. AGREEMENT NOT AUTOMATICALLY BINDING ON SUCCESSORS. The provisions of this Agreement shall apply during the term of this agreement only and shall not be binding on or inure to the benefit of the Parties hereto, their heirs, administrators, successors, or assigns, unless and until a subsequent written instrument specifically provides otherwise.

Method 2.

In the event of any disputes arising out of this Agreement, the Parties shall first engage in good faith negotiations to resolve such disputes amicably. If the parties fail to reach an agreement within a period of sixty (60) days following the commencement of negotiations, either party may initiate legal proceedings. The initiation of legal proceedings shall not relieve the parties of their obligation to continue negotiating in good faith, with the intention of resolving the dispute through alternative means such as mediation or arbitration, unless otherwise agreed upon by both parties in writing.

original: (a). Bizzingo will acquire basic business  information for a prospective user of the Network, which will include all or part of the following; business name and address,  telephone number, email address or website. This basic business information will be acquired through (i) arrangements with specific  groups, clubs, networks, or associations, such as Chambers of Commerce, Universities, or trade organization, to acquire member information, or (ii) through purchase or license arrangements with content providers. In either case, once Bizzingo obtains information  for a specific user, it will use that information to create or seed a separate user profile in its database for that prospective  user (“Seeded Profile ”). As of the date of this Agreement, Bizzingo has arrangements with content providers  and associations to provide the basic business information for over 6,000,000 prospective users which will be seeded by Bizzingo.  For clarification purposes, at this point in the process, a Seeded Profile is not an “Activated User. ” (b). In order to activate a  Seeded Profile, Bizzingo will contact a prospective user informing them of the existence of their Seeded Profile on the Network,  and the prospective user is then required to: (i) search and locate the Bizzingo database for its Seeded Profile and (ii) claim  the Seeded Profile by editing or adding content to the Seeded Profile. Once the steps set forth in the immediately preceding sentence  has been completed by a user, that user will be deemed to be an “Activated User ” and the Network will identify that  user as an Activated User.
ollama_generated: (a). The Network may collect essential business details for potential users, which could encompass elements such as business name, address, contact number, email address, or website. This information shall be gathered through two primary methods: (i) partnerships with particular groups, clubs, networks, or associations like Chambers of Commerce, Universities, or trade organizations to access member data, or (ii) acquisitions or licensing agreements with content providers. Upon procuring information for a specific user, Bizzingo will establish or initiate a separate user profile in its database, referred to as a "Proposed Profile." It is important to note that at this stage, a Proposed Profile does not equate to an "Active User." (b). For a Proposed Profile to be considered Active, the potential user must be informed about its existence on the Network. The user will then need to: (i) initiate a search within the Bizzingo database for their Proposed Profile and (ii) verify or customize the Proposed Profile by adding content. Once these actions have been carried out by the user, they will be recognized as an "Active User" and the Network shall identify them accordingly. However, it is worth noting that the onus of activating a Proposed Profile lies with the potential user.
